title: datalad drop clears out only a small proportion of the disk space used by previously downloaded files
body:
#### What is the problem?

`datalad drop` seems to clear out a small proportion of the disk space used by previously downloaded files of a dataset, which can easily be problematic when handling large datasets. 

The only way to clear out disk space is to delete the DataLad dataset and reinstall it. Am I missing something?

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
(disk space usage below is from the following DataLad dataset: https://github.com/conpdatasets/openpain-placebo_1.git) 
```
$ datalad install <dataset of your choice>
$ cd <dataset>
$ du -chs  # to get the size of the directory before running `datalad get`
25M	.
25M	total

$ datalad get *
$ du -chs  # to get the size of the directory after having downloaded all files of the dataset
626G	.
626G	total

$ datalad drop *
$ du -chs  # to get the size of the directory after having dropped all the files
510G	.
510G	total

```

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

```
$ datalad --version
datalad 0.15.1
```

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?

Not that I can think of

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)

I've been using it for a while now ;). Never checked the disk space after `datalad drop` before. Ran into disk space issues after downloading all CONP datasets to create zip files and noticed that `datalad drop` did not appear to free up much disk space once datasets have been fully downloaded...
